an5.191:1.1: “Mendicants, these five traditions of the brahmins are seen these days among dogs, but not among brahmins.
an5.191:1.3: In the past brahmins had sex only with brahmin women, not with others.
an5.191:1.4: These days brahmins have sex with both brahmin women and others.
an5.191:1.5: But these days dogs have sex only with female dogs, not with other species.
an5.191:1.6: This is the first tradition of the brahmins seen these days among dogs, but not among brahmins.
an5.191:2.1: In the past brahmins had sex only with brahmin women in the fertile half of the month that starts with menstruation, not at other times.
an5.191:2.2: These days brahmins have sex with brahmin women both in the fertile half of the month and at other times.
an5.191:2.3: But these days dogs have sex only with female dogs when they are in heat, not at other times.
an5.191:2.4: This is the second tradition of the brahmins seen these days among dogs, but not among brahmins.
an5.191:3.1: In the past brahmins neither bought nor sold brahmin women. They lived together because they loved each other and wanted their family line to continue.
an5.191:3.2: These days brahmins both buy and sell brahmin women. They live together whether they love each other or not and they want their family line to continue.
an5.191:3.3: But these days dogs neither buy nor sell female dogs. They live together because they’re attracted to each other and want their family line to continue.
an5.191:3.4: This is the third tradition of the brahmins seen these days among dogs, but not among brahmins.
an5.191:4.1: In the past brahmins did not store up money, grain, silver, or gold.
an5.191:4.2: These days brahmins do store up money, grain, silver, and gold.
an5.191:4.3: But these days dogs don’t store up money, grain, silver, or gold.
an5.191:4.4: This is the fourth tradition of the brahmins seen these days among dogs, but not among brahmins.
an5.191:5.1: In the past brahmins went looking for almsfood for dinner in the evening, and for breakfast in the morning.
an5.191:5.2: These days brahmins eat as much as they like until their bellies are full, then take away the leftovers.
an5.191:5.3: But these days dogs go looking for dinner in the evening, and for breakfast in the morning.
an5.191:5.4: This is the fifth tradition of the brahmins seen these days among dogs, but not among brahmins.
an5.191:5.5: These five traditions of the brahmins are seen these days among dogs, but not among brahmins.”
